c74object.name: sp.filter
c74object.digest: Apply filtering/routing to incoming descriptor messages
c74object.description: Apply filtering/routing to incoming descriptor messages.
c74object.discussion: Open the Overview Patch The sp.filter object allows you to selectively send incoming descriptor messages to one of two outlets depending on whether the filtering criteria is met. This allows you to fork processing based on audio characteristics.

inlet.description: Descriptor input as list or buffer~.
Descriptor input as list or buffer~ that will be filtered by the input of the left-most inlet.

outlet.digest: Descriptor output if conditions are met
outlet.description: Descriptor output if conditions are met. Output will be list or buffer~ based on what the input was.

outlet.digest: Descriptor output if conditions are not met
outlet.description: Descriptor output if conditions are not met. Output will be list or buffer~ based on what the input was.

attribute.name: filter
attribute.description: Messages related to descriptor filtering. After sending the filter message you send a series of additional arguments that determine what descriptor is being filtered, how it is being filtered, as well as further filtering strands combined with conditionals. The available descriptors that can be used for filtering are: loudness = loudness in dB loudness_derivative = derivative of loudness in dB centroid = centroid in MIDI pitch centroid_derivative = derivative of centroid in MIDI pitch flatness = spectral flatness in dB flatness_derivative = derivative of spectral flatness in dB pitch = pitch in MIDI pitch pitch_confidence = pitch confidence in 0 to 1 You can filter by the following operators: == = equals != = does not equal < = less than <= = less than or equal > = greater than >= = greater than or equal You can join multiple queries using: and or Therefore a complete message would look as follows: 'filter loudness < -45' or 'filter duration > 2500' or 'filter centroid > 60 and time_centroid < 80'
